papers.title: The Hardness of LPN over Any Integer Ring and Field for PCG Applications
papers.authors: Hanlin Liu, Xiao Wang, Kang Yang, Yu Yu
papers.notes: Placement in the tree is a bit random, since it's a general review/revisiting of the cryptanalysis of LPN in PCG-relevant parameter settings. Placed here because one of its primary motivations is the study of LPN over integer rings, which has been introduced for VOLE-based ZK over rings Z2k -- I picked the latest (at the time) in this family as the parent node.

papers.title: QuietOT: Lightweight Oblivious Transfer with a Public-Key Setup
papers.authors: Geoffroy Couteau, Lalita Devadas, Srinivasan Devadas, Alexander Koch, and Sacha Servan-Schreiber

papers.title: Practical cryptanalysis of pseudorandom correlation generators based on quasi-Abelian syndrome decoding
papers.authors: Charles Bouillaguet, Claire Delaplace, Mickaël Hamdad, Damien Vergnaud
papers.notes: Breaks QA-SD over small fields when the compression factor c is not large enough. In particular, this breaks the original parameters suggested in FOLEAGE (https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/429). The parameters can be updated to (provably) withstand the attack, at the cost of a significant (but reasonable) efficiency degradation.

papers.title: Pseudorandom Correlation Functions from Ring-LWR
papers.authors: Sebastian Hasler, Pascal Reisert, Ralf Küsters

papers.title: A New Algebraic Approach to the Regular Syndrome Decoding Problem and Implications for PCG Constructions
papers.authors: Pierre Briaud, Morten Øygarden
papers.notes: First indication that algebraic cryptanalysis is practically relevant against some regular-LPN parameters. Threatens only primal LPN instances.

papers.title: On the Soundness of Algebraic Attacks against Code-based Assumptions
papers.authors: Miguel Cueto Noval, Simon-Philipp Merz, Patrick Stählin, Akin Ünal

papers.title: Reduce and Prange: Revisiting Prange's ISD for Solving LPN/RSD over Large Fields
papers.authors: Jiseung Kim, Changmin Lee

papers.title: Not Just Regular Decoding: Asymptotics and Improvements of Regular Syndrome Decoding Attacks
papers.authors: Andre Esser, Paolo Santini

papers.title: Bit-fixing Correlation Attacks on Goldreich's Pseudorandom Generators
papers.authors: Ximing Fu, Mo Li, Shihan Lyu, Chuanyi Liu

papers.title: Compressing Unit-Vector Correlations via Sparse Pseudorandom Generators
papers.authors: Amit Agarwal, Elette Boyle, Niv Gilboa, Yuval Ishai, Mahimna Kelkar, Yiping Ma

papers.title: Improved Constructions for Distributed Multi-Point Functions
papers.authors: Elette Boyle, Niv Gilboa, Matan Hamilis, Yuval Ishai, Yaxin Tu
papers.notes: This improves distributed multi-point function. It's orthogonal to most PCGs, but the new construction is showcased by looking at how it improves FOLEAGE, so I placed it there, why not.

papers.title: Low-Communication Multiparty Triple Generation for SPDZ from Ring-LPN
papers.authors: Damiano Abram, Peter Scholl

papers.title: Preprocessing for Life: Dishonest-Majority MPC with a Trusted or Untrusted Dealer
papers.authors: Elette Boyle, Niv Gilboa, Matan Hamilis, Yuval Ishai, Ariel Nof
papers.notes: Not a follow-up to the previous paper by any mean, but the "next step" in maliciously-secure MPC with N>2 parties from PCGs, circumventing the need for multiparty authenticated Beaver triples

papers.title: Silentium: Implementation of a Pseudorandom Correlation Generator for Beaver Triples
papers.authors: Vincent Rieder
papers.conference: International Workshop on Foundations and Applications of Privacy-Enhancing Cryptography

papers.title: Pseudorandom Correlation Generators for Multiparty Beaver Triples over F2
papers.authors: Peihan Miao, Alice Murphy, Akshayaram Srinivasan, Max Tromanhauser
papers.notes: Techniques-wise, not a follow-up to BCG20a, as it combines primal & dual LPN (from the CCS'18 paper) with LWE-based AHE. However, the target (programmable PCGs, that imply multiparty PCGs for Beaver triples) makes it a follow-up as it targets a similar goal.

papers.title: AGB 2.0: Refined Algebraic Attack against Regular Syndrome Decoding for PCG Applications
papers.authors: Hanlin Liu, Xiao Wang, Kang Yang, Longhui Yin, Yu Yu

papers.title: Generation of Authenticated Secret-Shared Scaled Unit Vectors for Beaver Triples
papers.authors: Vincent Rieder

papers.title: A Hybrid Algorithm for the Regular Syndrome Decoding Problem
papers.authors: Tianrui Wang, Anyu Wang, Kang Yang, Hanlin Liu, Yu Yu, Jun Zhang, Xiaoyun Wang

colors.#e91e63: The original PCG constructions, and/or generic improvements to the original strategy
colors.#1abc9c: PCGs for OLEs from ring variants of LPN
colors.#f1c40f: "The quest for the right code": papers focused on developing better codes for silentOT
colors.#e67e22: "Ferret-style" protocols that inspired an influential line of work on VOLE-based ZK
colors.#2ecc71: Cryptanalysis focused on the regular syndrome decoding problem
colors.#55efc4: PCG-based solutions for (N>2)-MPC with malicious security
